intro: Sanilum bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored sanilum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, typically featuring a white or pale pink base with a contrasting red or purple center. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sanilum bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique floral display.
